title: Jak vrátit vzhled TB před poslední aktualizací?
content: Po aktualizaci na verzi 115.4.1 se po létech změnilo rozložení ovládání TB k horšímu. Pole rychlého filtru se přesunulo na horší místo, tlačítka rychlých filtrů apod. změnila vzhled. Namísto původního přehledného vybarvení tlačítka se na každém objevila jakási "svítící diodka" tak malá a nevýrazná, že její použití není na první pohled patrné. Celkově je nový skin plošší jak je dnes hloupým zvykem, ale to dovedu přežít. Jak vrátit původní rozložení a vzhled tlačítek rychlých filtrů? Hodně je používám.

title: collegamento thunderbird alla nuova casella istruzione.it ora con outlook.365 e non più con Aruba
content:
Buongiorno, sono un dipendente della scuola, il ministero per l’ennesima volta ha cambiato server e dopo Aruba questa volta si è connesso a Microsoft variando la casella di posta e tutti i parametri. Vorrei aprire la mia casella da Thunderbird e quindi ho creato il nuovo account da casella email esistente indicando i parametri richiesti (la maggior parte li aveva corretti, in automatico), tentando sia con la modalità imap che con il pop3. Sembrava fosse tutto ok, solo che quando vado a scaricare la posta, Thunderbird mi dice: il server outlook.office.365.com si è disconnesso. Il server potrebbe non essere disponibile o potrebbe esserci stato un problema di rete. La connessione è ottima, andando invece, direttamente su outlook.365 entro e vedo la posta senza problemi, sembra che tutto dipenda solo da Thunderbird, cosa posso fare  ? Grazie

P.S. il problema descritto riguarda solo la modalità imap, con il pop3 non mi fa accedere perchè dice che o è errato il nome utente o la password ma, ovviamente sono corretti, tanto che con gli stessi da web entro e vedo tutto

title: 11/06 UPDATE FOR V115 SCREWED UP ONE OF MY ACCOUNTS INBOX
content:
On the morning of 11/07/2023, when I brought up TBird, it duplicated the whole Inbox of my second email account (imap) to a subfolder of another subfolder in local storage. I moved them but it turned them into HTML. But I found out that the real ones were after those bad entries inside the inbox. I know this is confusing...or was it after I restored a backup and brought it up again? I did bring it up in Troubleshooting mode to stop the automatic fetching of accounts, but it was already changed from what I changed. Now I really do not know where the configuration is kept. This also screwed up my first account GMAIL Inbox (pop) and I lost everything since 07/2023. The control file must have gotten messed up because all my changes to fonts were gone. Also my storage folder location seemed to have been changed to another drive, which I fixed and all that came back. I backup the whole folder in Roaming and The TBird folder where my user files are kept on another drive. The whole .../mail/mail.gmail.com folder lost most of it's stuff (reverted back to 07/2023 data) and I cannot find a folder that has the "current" data that should be in that folder. I went back to a backup and NO backups have the complete current folder.

Also I would like to say that when the update was forced on us the other week (even though it is nice), it did not even say what it was doing. I thought it wasn't going to come up, but it finally did.

So it seems like I lost everything since 07/17/2023 in my gmail files. When I was looking, I did find a mail.gmail.com folder that seemed to have much more data, but now I do not know where it went and it is not in any of my backups, which is very strange. I do have storage folders for important things and I was able to point back to it and at least I got all of those. They are important.

I don't understand what happened. I have not brought any emails from Gmail in since 11/07 hoping I would find the files before I drained them from Gmail. Just using web right now. PITA! Anyone had this problem or can help me? I was up for hours early this morning trying to find that stupid folder which had more data. I know I saw it.

Thanks, Sam

title: Need compact density View for folder tree WHILE using spacious Default density View for message list & content
content:
With Thunderbird 115.4.2., the program no longer permits a compact density for the folder tree if you also need or prefer a more spacious ("default") setting for the emessage list and contents.

These spacing preferences should be separated...because the folder tree view does not change from minute to minute, so it does not need to be seen and studied as often. BUT the message list is constantly changing so users always need to at it more closely and frequently as messages are constantly arriving. 

  So more space more is more important for the message list than it is for the folder tree view.  And if you have many folders, as I do, you may want a more compact view of the folder tree to reduce need for constant scrolling....even though you may want--or need--an easy  to skim and see view of the message list, as I do.

After the redesign in the current version 115.4.25, it has now become either all too small, or all too spacious, but no longer possible to have a compact tree view for the folders and a more spacious or default view fpr the message list and contents. 

Can you please separate the density setting for the folder tree from the setting for the message list, or otherwise permit a setting that looks like "compact" for the folder tree list displayed at left, but also permits a more spacious, or "default" spacing for the message list when displayed horizontally above the message content?
